ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I got a much better understanding of aesthetic theory, particularly when it comes to the visual arts.
Close reading, research analysis, organizing ideas in an essay

How to write a college-level essay, how to effectively read academic literature, and how to synthesize existing arguments to create new knowledge are skills taught in any English 114 section. This course specifically focuses on art criticism and theoryI learned new ways of looking and thinking about visual art, language, and the world as a whole.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Being exposed to a wide range of interesting topics and thought-provoking questions. Writing assignments were also just as interesting and provided room for exploration. Scheduled one-on-one meetings with professor proved to be the most rewarding as it provided an opportunity to flesh out ideas and further engage in topics discussed during class. 
Weakness: Class discussions could be difficult to facilitate with more "philosophical" topics that are hard to grasp/communicate. It might help to summarize readings together or go over certain ideas that we found confusing for every reading at the beginning of class (concrete examples/visualization through chalkboard diagrams was very helpful)

Strengths: in-depth exploration of the field of art theory and criticism; students had some flexibility with what they chose to explore in their writing and were individually guided based on their areas of interest. Weaknesses: multiple changes in syllabus; occasional lack of structure in discussions.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend it to another student interested in aesthetic theory and/or art history.
Yes, this course really challenges the way you think and perceive art (and words like "interesting" and "thing") while introducing you to a plethora of important critics and ideas

Absolutely, especially if you are interested in humanities and arts, language and literary theory, or art history in particular. This course will give you exposure to iconic texts in art theory and criticism as well as artworks from a variety of movements.
